Afghanistan: Massacre of Elphinstone's army: A retreating British force of sixteen thousand was massacred by the Afghans.
Australia: Copper was discovered at Kapunda in South Australia.
Bhutan: Bhutan cedes control of the troublesome Bengal Duars to Britain.
China: First Opium War: The Qing dynasty and the United Kingdom signed the Treaty of Nanking, under which the former agreed to end the monopoly of the Cohong, pay reparations for the war and the destruction of opium, and cede Hong Kong Island in perpetuity.
England: The first peacetime income tax was introduced.
Haiti: An earthquake strikes northern Haiti, destroying the city of Cap-Haïtien
Japan: Tenpō Reforms lifts the price controls and further reduce contacts with Europeans.
Singapore: St. Margaret's Girls School is founded by Maria Tarn Dyer, the first and oldest all-girls school in Singapore
Tajikistan: First Anglo-Afghan War: The war ended with Afghanistan claiming victory.
USA: Dorr Rebellion: A civil war takes place in Rhode Island.
